subject: REST YOUR WEARY SOUL
verse: At this, I woke up and looked around. My sleep had been very sweet.(Jeremiah 31:26)
reflection: God Invites You to come to Him and He will restore and replenish your energy. He will refocus your mind and heart. He will supply your weary soul and you will wake feeling comforted and loved. Dear Lord, fill my weary soul with Your perfect peace.
prayer: Merciful God, fill our weary souls with Your perfect peace and replenish our energy as we come to You. Refocus our minds and hearts, that we may wake feeling comforted and loved by Your boundless grace. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1744c06b45c39945
subject   : Subject: REST YOUR WEARY SOUL (9-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 1 Sep 2020 18:35:42 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*At this, I woke up and looked around. My*

* sleep had been very sweet.*(Jer. 31:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God Invites You to come to Him and He

will restore and replenish your energy. He

will refocus your mind and heart. He will

supply your weary soul and you will wake

feeling comforted and loved. *Dear Lord,*

*fill my weary soul with Your perfect *

*peace.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: BE AN ENCOURAGER
verse: “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?” they asked. “Hasn’t He also spoken through us?” and the Lord heard this. (Hebrews 12:2)
reflection:
IN THE ABOVE verse, when Mariam and
Aaron witnessed God using Moses, they
were jealous. Praising others and being
happy for other’s spiritual or natural gifts
can be difficult. But when you recognize
that your work and your relationship with
God is equally important, you can truly appreciate the blessings of others and be positive about their achievements.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to overcome jealousy and truly celebrate the gifts and achievements of others, recognizing that each person's relationship with You is unique and valuable. May we find contentment in our own spiritual journey and support one another with genuine joy and appreciation. (AI)

*Subject: BE AN ENCOURAGER *(9-3-20)



*Today’s Verse: *

*“Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?”*

*they asked. “Hasn’t He also spoken through*

*us?” and the Lord heard this. *(Heb. 12:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

IN THE ABOVE verse, when Mariam and

Aaron witnessed God using Moses, they

were jealous. Praising others and being

happy for other’s spiritual or natural gifts

can be difficult. But when you recognize

that your work and your relationship with

God is equally important, *you can truly*

*appreciate the blessings of others and*

*be positive about their achievements. *

* Pastor Sather *

subject: RIGHT YOUR WRONGS
verse:
Godliness helps people all through life, while the evil are
destroyed by their wickedness. (Proverbs 13:6)
reflection:
Godly living safeguards your life. Every choice for good
sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices
follow the same patter, but in an opposite direction. Each
decision you make to obey God will bring a greater sense of
order to your life, while each decision to disobey will
bring confusion and destruction. The right choices you make
reflect your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest
safeguard and security.
prayer:
Lord, anchor my heart in Your wisdom so that each choice I
make moves me toward goodness, order, and integrity. Train
my will to obey You quickly, guard me from paths that lead
to confusion and harm, and strengthen me to walk securely in
Your ways. May my daily decisions reflect a life safeguarded
by Your truth. Amen. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Godliness helps people all through life, *

*while **the evil are destroyed by their wickedness. *(Pro. 13:6)



*Today’s Verse:*

Godly living safeguards your life.

Every choice for good sets into motion

other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same patter, but in
an opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God will bring a
greater sense of order to

your life, while each decision to disobey

will bring confusion and destruction*. *

The right choices you make reflect your integrity. *Obe**dience **brings
the greatest safeguard and **security.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: THE SECRET TO ABUNDANT LIFE
verse: The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and  destroy. My purpose is to give life in all its  fullness. (John 10:10)
reflection:
In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus gives life.
The life He gives right now is abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet it begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived on a higher plain because of his overflowing forgiveness, love, and guidance
Have you taken Christ’s offer of life?
prayer: Lord of Life, thank you for the abundant and eternal life you offer through Jesus Christ, filled with forgiveness, love, and guidance. May we gratefully accept and fully embrace this rich, overflowing life that begins now and continues forever. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and *

*destroy. **My purpose is to give life in all its *

*fullness. *(Jn. 10:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus

gives life. The life He gives right now is

abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet it

begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived

on a higher plain because of his overflowing forgiveness, love, and guidance

*Have you taken Christ’s offer of life?*

* Pastor Sather*.

subject: KEEPING YOUR EYES FIXED ON JESUS
verse: Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart? You lied to the Holy Spirit and you kept some of the money for yourself. (Acts 5:3)
reflection:
Even though the Holy Spirit had come, the believers
were not immune to Satan’s temptations. Although
Satan was defeated by Christ at the cross he was
actively trying to make believers stumble-just as he
is still at it today (Ephesians 6:12; I Peter 5:8) Thank the Lord
Satan’s overthrow is inevitable, but it will not occur until the last days, when Jesus returns to judge the world (Revelation 20:10).
prayer: Almighty God, protect us from the schemes of the enemy and strengthen our faith to resist temptation. Help us to stand firm in the knowledge of Christ's ultimate victory, eagerly awaiting His return. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17460481c66aebf6
subject   : Subject: KEEPING YOUR EYES FIXED ON JESUS (9-6-20)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 5 Sep 2020 16:59:33 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart?*

*You lied to the Holy Spirit and you kept some of the*

*money for yourself. *(Acts. 5:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Even though the Holy Spirit had come, the believers

were not immune to Satan’s temptations. Although

Satan was defeated by Christ at the cross he was

actively trying to make believers stumble—just as he

is still at it today (Eph. 6:12; I Pet. 5:8) Thank the Lord

Satan’s overthrow is inevitable, *but it will not occur *

*until the last days, when Jesus returns to judge the *

*world (Rev. 20:10).*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: PRAY PERSISTENTLY BELIEVING
verse: Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and a thankful heart. (Colossians 4:2)
reflection:
Have you ever grown tired of praying for something
or someone? Paul says we should “devote” ourselves
to prayer and be “alert” in prayer. Our persistence is
an expression of our faith that God answers prayers.
Faith should’t die if the answers come slowly, for
the delay may be God’s way of working His will in
our life. When you feel tired of praying, know that
God is present, always listening always answering maybe not in ways you hoped, but in ways that He knows are best.
prayer: Faithful God, strengthen our resolve to persist in prayer, even when answers seem delayed, and help us trust that You are always listening and working for our good. Grant us the patience and alertness to discern Your will through our prayers and the faith to accept Your perfect timing. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174655e03c107db3
subject   : Subject: PRAY PERSISTENTLY BELIEVING (9-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 6 Sep 2020 16:41:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and a*

*thankful heart. *(Col. 4:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have you ever grown tired of praying for something

or someone? Paul says we should “devote” ourselves

to prayer and be “alert” in prayer. Our persistence is

an expression of our faith that God answers prayers.

Faith shouldn’t die if the answers come slowly, for

the delay may be God’s way of working His will in

our life. When you feel tired of praying, know that

God is present, always listening always answering—

maybe not in ways you hoped, *but in ways that **He *

*knows are best.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE HARDEST PART
verse: Wait for the Lord: be strong and take heart and wait  for  the Lord. (Psalm 27:14)
reflection:
David knew from experience what it meant to wait for
the Lord. He had been anointed king at the age of 16
but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased through the wilderness by jealous king Saul. Davie had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. Later, after becoming king he was chased by his rebellious son. Some Times God Calls us to wait and not act.
Our job is to continue to trust Him along the way. To surrender our will to His, to exchange our timing for His KNOWING that He holds every moment in His hands.
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the patience and trust to wait upon Your perfect timing, even when the path ahead seems uncertain or delayed. Help us surrender our will to Yours, knowing that You hold every moment of our lives in Your loving hands. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1746a82049d7f126
subject   :

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;

*Subject: THE HARDEST PART *(9-8-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Wait for the Lord: be strong and take heart and wait *

*for **the Lord. **(Ps. 27:14)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

David knew from experience what it meant to wait for

the Lord. He had been anointed king at the age of 16

but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased
through the wilderness by

jealous king Saul. Davie had to wait on God for the fulfilment of his
promise to reign. Later, after becoming king he was chased by his rebellious
son*. Some Times God Calls *us to wait and not act. Our job is to continue

to trust Him along the way. *To **surrender our will to *

*His, to exchange our timing for **His KNOWING *

*that He holds every moment in His **hands.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD'S WORDS ARE FLAWLESS
verse:
The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul. The decrees of the Lord are trustworthy, making wise the simple. (Psalm 19:7)—for further reading
read verses 8-11
reflection:
When we think of the law, we often think of
something that keeps us from having fun. But
here we see the opposite. God’s laws revive us,
make us wise, bring joy to the heart, give us
insight, warn us, and reward us. God’s laws
are guidelines and lights for our path, rather
than chains to our feet and hands. They point at danger to warn us, then point at success to guide us.
prayer: Holy God, help us to see Your laws as a source of wisdom, joy, and guidance in our lives, rather than as burdensome restrictions. May we embrace Your commandments as a light for our path, warning us of dangers and leading us toward true fulfillment and success. (AI)
original_content:

===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul.*

*The decrees of the Lord are trustworthy, making*

*wise the simple. *(Ps. 19:7)—for further reading

read verses 8-11


*Today’s Reflection:*

When we think of the law, we often think of

something that keeps us from having fun. But

here we see the opposite. God’s laws revive us,

make us wise, bring joy to the heart, give us

insight, warn us, and reward us. God’s laws

are guidelines and lights for our path, rather

than chains to our feet and hands. *They point*

* at danger to warn us, then point at success*

*to guide us.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: DEPEND ON CHRIST'S POWER
verse: So everywhere we go we tell everyone about Christ. We warn them and teach them with all the wisdom God has given us, for we want to present them to God, perfect in their relationship to Christ. I work very hard at this, as I depend on Christ’s mighty power that works within us. (Colossians 1:28-29)
reflection:
Christ’s message is for everyone; so everywhere Paul and Timothy went, they brought the Good News to all who would listen. An effective presentation of the Good News includes warning and teaching.
The warning is that without Christ, people are doomed to eternal separation from God. The teaching is that salvation is available through faith in Christ. As Christ works in you, tell others about Him, warning and teaching
them in love. Whom do you know who needs to hear this message.
prayer: Lord of Life, inspire us to share the Good News of salvation through Christ with everyone we encounter, warning them lovingly of the consequences of separation from You and teaching them about the hope found in faith. Guide us to those who need to hear this message, and give us the courage and wisdom to speak Your truth with compassion and clarity. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17474d36cf054ccc
subject   : Subject: DEPEND ON CHRIST'S POWER (9-10-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*So everywhere we go we tell everyone about Christ.*

*We warn them and teach them with all the wisdom*

*God has given us, for we want to present them to*

*God, perfect in their relationship to Christ. I work*

*very hard at this, as I depend on Christ’s mighty*

*power that works within us. *(Col 1:28-29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christ’s message is for everyone; so everywhere Paul

and Timothy went, they brought the Good News to all

who would listen. An effective presentation of the Good

News includes warning and teaching. The warning is

that without Christ, people are doomed to eternal

separation from God. The teaching is that salvation

is available through faith in Christ. As Christ works

in you, tell others about Him, warning and teaching

them in love*. Whom do you know who needs **to hear *

*this message.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: OUR NEEDED HELP
verse: The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we don’t even know what we should pray for, nor how we should pray. But the Holy Spirit prays for us with groaning that cannot be expressed in words.—And the Father who knows all hearts knows what the Spirit is saying, for the Spirit pleads for us believers  in harmony with God’s own will.  (Romans 8:26, 27)
reflection:
As a believer, you are not left to your own
resources to cope with your problems. Even
when you don’t know the right words to pray,
the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and
God answers. With God helping you pray,
you don’t need to be afraid to come before
Him.
Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for
you,” in harmony with God’s will.” Then, when you bring your request to God trust that He will always do what is best.
prayer: Faithful God, we thank You for the gift of the Holy Spirit who intercedes for us when we struggle to find the right words to pray. Help us to trust in Your perfect will and to approach You without fear, knowing that You always hear us and do what is best. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we **don’t even know what we
should pray for, nor **how we should pray. But the Holy Spirit prays **for
us with groanings that cannot be expressed **in words.—And the Father who
knows all hearts **knows what the Spirit is saying, for the Spirit **pleads
for us believers *

*in harmony with God’s** own will. *

(Ro. 8:26, 27)

*Today’ Reflection:*

As a believer, you are not left to your own

resources to cope with your problems. Even

when you don’t know the right words to pray,

the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and

God answers. With God helping you pray,

you don’t need to be afraid to come before

Him. Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for

you,” in harmony with God’s will.” *Then,*

*when you bring your request to God trust*

*that He will always do what is best.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: BEYOND COMPREHENSION
verse: How great is God—beyond our understanding! The  number of His years is past finding out.  (Job 36:26) NIV
reflection: It goes without saying that God is incomprehensible; we cannot know Him completely. We can have some knowledge about Him, for the Bible is full of details about who God is, how can we know Him, and how we have an eternal relationship with Him. But we can never know enough to answer all of life’s questions (Ecclesiastes 3:11), to predict our future, or to manipulate God for our own ends. Life always creates more questions than we have answers, and we must constantly go to God for fresh insights into life’s dilemmas. (See Job 37:19-24)
prayer: Eternal God, as we ponder Your incomprehensible nature, grant us the humility to seek You continually for wisdom and guidance in life's uncertainties. May we find peace in knowing You, even as we acknowledge the vastness of what remains unknown to us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1747f45ac2067b30
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 11 Sep 2020 17:25:07 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: BEYOND COMPREHENSION *(9-12-20)



*Today’s Verse*

*How great is God—beyond our understanding! The *

*number of His years is past finding out. *

(Job 36:26) NIV

*Today’s Reflection:*

It goes without saying that God is incomprehensible; we cannot know Him
completely. We can have some knowledge about Him, for the Bible is full of
details about who God is, how can we know Him, and how we have an eternal
relationship with Him. But we

can never know enough to answer all of life’s questions (Eccl. 3:11), to
predict our future, or to manipulate God for our own ends. Life always

creates more questions than we have answers, and

*we must constantly go to God **for fresh insights *

*into life’s dilemmas*. (See Job 37:19-24)

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GRASP THE OPPORTUNITY
verse: So, my dear brothers and sisters, be strong and steady, always enthusiastic about the Lord’s  work, for you know that nothing you do for the Lord is ever useless. (I Corinthians 15:58)
reflection:
Paul says because of the resurrection, nothing we
do is useless. Sometimes we become apathetic
about serving the Lord because we don’t see any
results. Knowing that Christ has won the ultimate victory should affect the way we live right now. Don’t let discouragement over an apparent lack of results keep you from doing the work of the Lord enthusiastically as you have an opportunity.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to serve you with enthusiasm and perseverance, trusting that our efforts are never in vain because of Christ's victory. May we be encouraged to seize every opportunity to do your work, knowing that the resurrection gives eternal significance to all we do in your name. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174845d35938a510
subject   : Subject: GRASP THE OPPORTUNITY (9-13-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 12 Sep 2020 17:08:55 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*So, my dear brothers and sisters, be strong and*

*steady, always enthusiastic about the Lord’s *

*work, for you know that nothing you do for*

*the Lord is ever useless. *(I Cor. 15:58)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul says because of the resurrection, nothing we

do is useless. Sometimes we become apathetic

about serving the Lord because we don’t see any

results. Knowing that Christ has won the ultimate

victory should affect the way we live right now.

Don’t let discouragement over an apparent lack

of results keep you from doing the work of the

Lord enthusiastically as you have an opportunity.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: PRAISING ON DARK DAYS
verse: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners  were listening to them. (Acts 16:25)
reflection: It is easy to be happy when everything is going your way, but how you respond to dark and difficult times is a test of true character. In our verse today despite their suffering, Paul and Silas praise God. They worship in the worst of circumstances and inspire others by their actions. Dear Lord help me to hold on to faith when suffering pain or encountering other difficulties, so that I maybe a testimony to your glory.
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the strength to praise You even in our darkest hours, following the example of Paul and Silas who worshiped You despite their suffering. Help us to remain faithful witnesses to Your glory, inspiring others through our unwavering trust in You, no matter the circumstances we face. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing **hymns to God, and
the other prisoners *

*were listening to **them. *(Acts 16:25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*It is easy to be happy* *when* everything is going your way, but how you
respond to dark and diff-icult times is a test of true character. In our
verse today despite their suffering, Paul and Silas praise God. They
worship in the worst of circumstances and inspire others by their actions.
*Dear **Lord *

*help me to hold on to faith when suffering pain*

*or encountering other difficulties, so that I maybe a **testimony to your
glory.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: LIVING WITH A CHRIST-LIKE ATTITUDE
verse: May God who gives patience and encouragement, help you live in complete harmony with each other—each  with the attitude of Christ Jesus toward the other— Then all of you can join together with one voice, giving praise and glory to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. (Romans 15:5-6)
reflection:
Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority of Scripture,
the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His attitude of love toward other Christians as well. As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will become more capable of maintaining this attitude of loving unity throughout each day.
prayer: Loving God, help us to grow in our faith and knowledge of Jesus, so that we may better embody His attitude of love toward all our fellow Christians. May we cultivate a spirit of unity and compassion in our daily lives, reflecting the love You have shown us. (AI)
original_content:

*May God who gives patience and encouragement, help you** live in complete

*with the **attitude of Christ Jesus toward the other—*

*Then all of you **can join together with one voice, giving praise and
glory **to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. *(Ro. 15:5-6)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority of Scripture,

have His attitude of love toward other Christians as well. As we grow in
faith and come to know Jesus better, *we will be**come more capable of
maintaining this attitude of lov**ing unity throughout each day.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: HIS WORD OUR 20/20 VISION
verse: Then Jesus told them, “You believe because you have seen me.  Blessed are those who have not seen me and believe anyway. (John 20:29)
reflection: Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite sign or miracle. But Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without seeing. Remember we have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible and the testimony of believers. A physical appearance would not make Jesus any more real to us than He is now.
prayer: Dear Lord help me to see You more clearly in the words of the Bible—Amen.
original_content:
message_id: 17493d5a2d7c6c19
subject   : Subject: HIS WORD OUR 20/20 VISION (9-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus told them, “You believe because you have seen me. **Blessed are
those who have not seen me and believe anyway. **(Jn. 20:29)*

*Today’s Reflection:*

Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite
sign or miracle. *But *Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without
seeing. *Remember* we have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible
and the testimony of believers. *A physical appearance would not make
Jesus **any more real to us than He is now.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Dear Lord help me to see You more clearly in the words **of the
Bible—Amen. *

subject: BECOMING NEW
verse: The one siting on the throne said, “I am making all things new!” And He also said, “write this down for what I tell you is trustworthy and true.” (Revelation 21:5)
reflection:
God is the Creator. The Bible begins with the
majestic story of His creation of the universe,
and it concludes with His creation of a new
heaven and a new earth. This is a tremendous
hope and encouragement for the believer.
When we are with God, with our sins forgiven
and our future secure, we will be like Christ. We will be made perfect like Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, today I will seek out the unfamiliar. And embrace new experiences…Amen.
original_content:

subject   : Subject: BECOMING NEW (9-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verse:*

*The one siting on the throne said, “I am making*

* all things new!” And He also said, “write this*

* down, for what I tell you is trustworthy and*

*true.”*



*Today’s Reflection:*

God is the Creator. The Bible begins with the

majestic story of His creation of the universe,

and it concludes with His creation of a new

heaven and a new earth. This is a tremendous

hope and encouragement for the believer.

When we are with God, with our sins forgiven

and our future secure, we will be like Christ.

*We will be made perfect like Him.*

*Pastor Sather*



*Dear Lord, today I will seek out the unfamiliar*

*And embrace new experiences…Amen.*

subject: LETS EXAMINE OUR MOTIVES
verse: “Stop judging others, and you will not be judged.for others will treat you as you treat them. Whatever measure you use in judging others, it will be used to measure how you are judged.” (Matthew 7:1-2)
reflection:
Jesus tells us to examine our own motives and conduct instead of judging others. The traits that bother us in others are often the habits we have ourselves. Our bad habits and behavior patterns are the very ones that we most want to change in others. Do you find it easy to magnify other’s faults while excusing your own? If you are ready to criticize someone, check to see if you deserve the same criticism.
Judge yourself first, and then lovingly forgive and help your neighbor.
prayer: Holy God, help us to examine our own hearts and actions before passing judgment on others, and grant us the humility to recognize our own faults and the grace to forgive those around us. May we strive to embody the love and compassion of Christ in all our interactions, seeking to uplift and support one another rather than criticize. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*“Stop judging others, and you will not be judged.for others will treat you
as you treat them. Whatever measure you use in judging others, it will be
used to measure how you are judged.” *(Mt 7:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus tells us to examine our own motives and con-duct instead of judging
others. The traits that bother us in others are often the habits we have
ourselves. Our bad habits and behavior patterns are the very ones that we
most want to change in others. Do you find it easy to magnify other’s
faults while excusing your own? If you are ready to criticize someone,
check to see if you deserve the same criticism. *Judge yourself first, and
then lovingly forgive and help your neighbor. *

* Pastor Sather *

subject: THE WAY IS PREPARED
verse: “Don’t be troubled. You trust in God, now trust in Me , there are many rooms in My Father’s home, and I am going to prepare a place for you .If this were not so, I would tell you plainly. When everything is ready, I will come and get you.” (John 14:1-3)
reflection:
Jesus’
words show that the way to eternal life, though unseen, is secure-as secure as your faith in Jesus. He has already prepared the way to eternal life. The only issue that may still be unsettled is your willingness to believe. Yes we can look forward to eternal life because Jesus has promised it to all who believe in Him. Although the details of eternity are unknown, we need not fear because Jesus is preparing it for us and will spend eternity with us.
prayer: Faithful God, strengthen our trust in Your Son's promise of eternal life, and help us to embrace the assurance of our heavenly home with unwavering faith. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174a3566328d10e5
subject   : Subject: THE WAY IS PREPARED (9-19-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 18 Sep 2020 17:29:42 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*“Don’t be troubled. You trust in God, now trust in Me , there are many
rooms in My Father’s home, and I am going to prepare a place for you .If
this were not so, I would tell you plainly. When every-thing is ready, I
will come and get you.”* (Jn. 14:1-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus’ words show that the way to eternal life, though unseen, is
secure—as secure as your faith in Jesus. He has already prepared the way to
eternal life. The only issue that may still be unsettled is your
willingness to believe. Yes we can look forward to eternal life because
Jesus has promised it to all who believe in Him. *Although the details of
eternity are unknown, we need not fear* *because Jesus is pre-paring it for
us and will spend eternity with us.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: USING FAITH FOR THE RIGHT REASON
verse: What do you mean, “If I can?” Jesus asked. Anything is possible if a person believes. (Mark 9:23)
reflection:
Take note here, Jesus’ words do not mean that we can
automatically obtain anything we want if we just think
positively.
Jesus really meant that anything is possible
if we believe, because nothing is to difficult for God. We cannot have everything we pray for as if by magic, but with faith, we can have everything we need to serve Him. No matter how much faith we have, we never reach the point of being self-sufficient.
prayer: Almighty God, help us to trust in Your limitless power and align our desires with Your will, knowing that through faith in You, we can accomplish all that You call us to do. Grant us the humility to recognize our dependence on You and the wisdom to seek Your guidance in all our endeavors. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: USING FAITH FOR THE RIGHT REASON (9-20-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*What do you mean, “If I can?” **Jesus asked. Anything is **possible if a
person believes. *(Mk 9:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Take note here, Jesus’ words do not mean that we can

automatically obtain anything we want if we just think

positively. Jesus really meant that anything is possible

if we believe, because nothing is to difficult for God. We cannot have
everything we pray for as if by magic, but with faith, we can have
everything we need to serve Him. *No matter how much faith we have,*

*we never **reach the point of being self-sufficient.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: THE LORD WILL STRETCH OUR MEASLY GIFTS
verse: But Jesus replied,” ”That isn’t necessary—you feed them.” “Impossible!” they exclaimed. “We have only five loafs and two fish!” “Bring them here,” He said.  Then He told the people to sit down on the grass. And He took the five loafs and two fish, looked toward heaven, and asked God’s blessing on the food.  (Matthew 14: 16—18a)
reflection: Jesus desires that we should surrender to is service the little we have, our small gifts and strengths and resources. The rest He will look after. His blessing will make the little suffice. Unbelief says that it is insufficient to come with the little we have for an enterprise so great! Faith says, Jesus asks for the little we have, and He will take it into His service. He will bless it until there is more than enough. When we lay our gift in the Lord’s hand (and not in any man’s) it will stretch as far as the Lord wills.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to surrender our small gifts and resources to Your service, trusting that Your blessing will make them sufficient for great purposes. May we have the faith to place all we have in Your hands, knowing that You can multiply our offerings beyond our imagination. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*But Jesus replied,” ”That isn’t necessary—you feed them.” “Impossible!”** they
exclaimed. “We have only five loafs and two fish!” “Bring them here,” **He
said. *

*Then He told the people to sit down on the grass. And He took the **five
loafs and two fish, looked toward heaven, and asked God’s blessing on **the
food. *

(Mt. 14: 16—18a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus desires that we should surrender to is service

the little we have, our small gifts and strengths and

resources. The rest He will look after. His blessing

will make the little suffice. Unbelief says that it is insufficient to come
with the *little** we have for an*

enterprise so great! Faith says, Jesus asks for the

little we have, and He will take it into His service.

He will bless it until there is more than enough. *When we lay our gift
in the Lord’s hand *

*(and * *not in any man’s)** it will stretch as *

*far as the Lord wills.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A RIGHT RELATIONSHIP IS A HEAT-FELT TRUST
verse: And Abraham believed the Lord, and the Lord declared him righteous because of his faith.  (Genesis 15:6)
reflection:
Although Abram had been demonstrating his faith
Through his actions, it was his belief in the Lord,
not his actions, that made Abram right with God
(Romans 41:5). YES, we too, can have a right relation ship with God by trusting Him. Our outward actions,
church attendance, prayer, good deeds-will not by
themselves make us right will Good. A right relationship is based on faith-the heartfelt inner confidence that God is who He says He is and does what He says He will do. Right actions will follow naturally as by products.
prayer: Holy God, help us to trust in You fully, knowing that it is our faith, not our deeds alone, that makes us right with You. May our actions flow naturally from a heart that believes in Your promises and Your character. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174b2da4173c7efa
subject   : Subject: A RIGHT RELATIONSHIP IS A HEAT-FELT TRUST (9-22-20)

date      : Mon, 21 Sep 2020 17:48:02 -0500

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*And Abraham believed the Lord, and the Lord declared him righteous because
of his faith. *

(Gen. 15:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Although Abram had been demonstrating his faith

Through his actions, it was his belief in the Lord,

not his actions, that made Abram right with God

(Ro. 41:5). YES, we too, can have a right relation-

ship with God by trusting Him. Our outward actions,

church attendance, prayer, good deeds—will not by

themselves make us right will Good. A right relationship is based on
faith—the heartfelt inner confidence that God is who He says He is and does
what He says He will do. *Right actions will follow naturally as by-*
*products.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: PERFECTING ONES FAITH
verse:
Later on God tested Abram’s faith and obedience. “Abraham!” God called. “Yes” he replied. “He I am.” “Take your son, your only son—yes, Isaac, whom you love so much—and go to the land of Moriah.
Sacrifice him there as a burn offering on  one of the mountains, which I will point out to you.” The next morning Abraham got up early. He saddled his donkey and took two of his servants with him, along with his son Isaac, (Genesis 22:1-3a)
reflection: God tested Abraham, not to trip him up and watch him fall, but to deepen his capacity to obey God and thus to develop his character. Just as fire refines ore to extract precious metals. I believe you will agree that God has refined us a time or two through diffi cult circumstance. When we are tested we can complain, or we can try to see how God is stretching us, to develop our character. Obeying God is often a struggle because it may mean giving up something we truly want. We should not expect our obedience to God to be easy or to come naturally.
prayer: Faithful God, as You refine our character through trials and challenges, grant us the strength to obey Your will even when it means surrendering our own desires. Help us to see Your purpose in our struggles and to grow in faith and obedience through every test we face. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174b80abf8c02706
subject   : Subject: PERFECTING ONES FAITH (9-23-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Tue, 22 Sep 2020 17:59:06 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Later on God tested Abram’s faith and obedience.*

*“Abraham!” God called. “Yes” he replied. “He*

*I am.” “Take your son, your only son—yes, Isaac, whom you love so much—and
go to the land of*

*Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burn offering on *

*one of the mountains, which I will point out to you.” The next morning
Abraham got up early. He saddled his donkey and took two of his servants
with him, along with his son Isaac, *(Gen. 22:1-3a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God tested Abraham, not to trip him up and watch

him fall, but to deepen his capacity to obey God and thus to develop his
character. Just as fire refines ore

to extract precious metals. I believe you will agree

that God has refined us a time or two through diffi-

cult circumstance. When we are tested we can com-plain, or we can try
to see how God is stretching us,

to develop our character. Obeying God is often a struggle because it may
mean giving up something

we truly want.* We should not expect our obedience to God to be easy or to
come naturally.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PATIENTLY LIVE BY FAITH
verse: Look at the proud! They trust in themselves, and their lives are crooked.; but the righteous will live by their faith. (Habakkuk 2:4)
reflection:
The wicked Babylonians trusted in themselves and would fall, but the righteous live by their faith and trust in God. This verse has inspired countless Christ ians. Paul quotes It in Romans 1:17, and in Galatians, 3:11. The writer of Hebrewsquotes it in 10:38, just before the chap ter on faith.
And it is helpful to all Christians who must live through difficult times without seeing signs of hope. Christians must trust that God is directing all things according to His purpose.
prayer: Almighty God, grant us unwavering faith to trust in Your divine plan, even when we cannot see signs of hope in difficult times. Help us to live righteously, drawing strength from Your promises and guidance, as we navigate the challenges of this world. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174bcf30abd46e93
subject   : Subject: PATIENTLY LIVE BY FAITH (9-24-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 23 Sep 2020 16:51:19 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Look at the proud! They trust in themselves, and their*

*lives are crooked.; but the righteous will live by their*

*faith. *(Hab. 2:4)


*Today’s Reflection:*

The wicked Babylonians trusted in themselves and

would fall, but the righteous live by their faith and

trust in God. This verse has inspired countless Christ-

ians. Paul quotes It in Ro. 1:17, and in Gal, 3:11. The writer of Heb.
quotes it in 10:38, just before the chap-

ter on faith. And it is helpful to all Christians who must live through
difficult times with-out seeing signs of hope*. Christians must trust that
God is **directing all things according to His purpose.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: ANXIETY IS A LACK OF TRUE FAITH
verse: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which  today is alive and tomorrow is thrown into the  oven, will He not much more clothe you? O you  of little faith! (Matthew 6:30)
reflection:
God so clothes. Here we have an argument from the
lesser to the greater. If God adorns common plants
with such beauty, how much more will He lavish
good things on the crown of His creation? Little faith! This criticism typically comes after people
underestimate God or His Son. How great is your faith.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust in Your abundant provision and care for all Your creation, especially for us whom You have made in Your image. Increase our faith, that we may fully rely on Your goodness and generosity in every aspect of our lives. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174c224c69b87a62
subject   : Subject: ANXIETY IS A LACK OF TRUE FAITH (9-25-20)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 24 Sep 2020 17:03:44 -0500

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which *

*today **is alive and tomorrow is thrown into the *

*oven, **will He **not much more clothe you? O you *

*of little faith! *(Mt. 6:30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*God so clothes. *Here we have an argument from the

lesser to the greater. If God adorns common plants

with such beauty, how much more will He lavish

good things on the crown of His creation? *Little*

* faith! *This criticism typically comes after people

underestimate God or His Son. *How great is your*

*faith.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: CHRISTIANS NEED TO STAND UP AND BE HEARD
verse:
When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but
when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn. (Proverbs 29:2 AI)
reflection:
What am I talking about? All we need to do is
listen to the news and see that Christians need
to vote for people with Christian values or we
will no longer have a say in who will lead the
country in the future. Our vote will no longer
be counted. The leader will be decided before
hand.
prayer:
Lord, grant us wisdom and discernment to honor You in how we
steward our vote. Raise up leaders of integrity, justice,
and truth, and give Your people unity, courage, and peace as
we engage faithfully. Help us trust Your sovereignty while
acting responsibly for the good of our communities and
nation. Amen. (AI)

subject: BE CAREFUL NOT TO LIMIT GOD
verse:
Jesus was amazed, turning to the crowd He said,
“I tell you the truth, I haven’t seen faith life this
in all the land of Israel!” (Matthew 8:10)
reflection:
Jesus told the crowd that many religious Jews who
should be in the Kingdom would be excluded be cause of their lack of faith. What would Jesus say
about your faith?
We must be careful not to become
so set in our religious habits that we expect God to
work only in specific ways. Don’t limit God by your mindset and lack of faith. . .
prayer: Lord of Life, open our hearts to recognize Your limitless power and unexpected ways of working in our lives, and strengthen our faith to trust in Your plans beyond our understanding. Help us to break free from rigid religious habits and embrace a dynamic, living relationship with You. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

Jesus was amazed, turning to the crowd He said,

“I tell you the truth, I haven’t seen faith life this

in all the land of Israel!” (Mt 8:10)



*Today’s Reflection: *

Jesus told the crowd that many religious Jews who

should be in the Kingdom would be excluded be-

cause of their lack of faith. *What would Jesus say*

*about your faith*? We must be careful not to become

so set in our religious habits that we expect God to

work only in specific ways. *Don’t limit God by *

*your mind-set and lack of faith. . .*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: FOLLOW UP, OF THE WITHERED
verse: Then Jesus told them, “I assure you that if you have  faith and do not doubt, you can do things like this and much more. You can even say to this mountain, ‘may  God lift you up and throw you into the sea,’ and it will happen.” (Matthew 21:21)
reflection:
Many have wondered about Jesus’ statement that if we have faith and do not doubt, we can move moun tains. Jesus of course, was not suggesting that His followers use prayer as some “magic” act. Instead, He was making a strong point about the disciples’ (and our) lack of faith.
What kinds of mountains do you face? Have you really talked to God about them? How strong is your faith?
prayer: Faithful God, strengthen our trust in You so that we may approach the mountains in our lives with unwavering faith, bringing our challenges before You in earnest prayer. Help us to grow in confidence, knowing that with You, all things are possible. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174cc990b63967dc

*Subject: FOLLOW UP, OF THE WITHERED *

* FIG TREE* (9-27-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus told them, “I assure you that if you have *

*faith and d**o not doubt, you can do things like this and much more. You** can
even say to this mountain, ‘may *

*God lift you up and throw** you into the sea,’ and it will happen.” *(Mt.
21:21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many have wondered about Jesus’ statement that if

we have faith and do not doubt, we can move moun-

tains. Jesus of course, was not suggesting that His followers use prayer as
some “magic” act. Instead,

He was making a strong point about the disciples’

(*and our*) lack of faith.

What kinds of mountains do you face? Have you

*really *talked to God about them? *How strong is your faith?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: CALMING STORMS
verse: (The disciples fear of the storm) “Teacher, don’t you even care that we are going to drown?” When He woke up, He rebuked the wind and said to the water, “Quiet down.” Suddenly the wind stopped, and there was a great calm. And He asked them, “why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith in Me?” (Mark 5:38b-40)
reflection:
:
The disciples panicked because the storm threatened to destroy them all, and Jesus seemed unaware and unconcerned. Theirs was a physical storm, but storms also come in other forms. Think about the storms in your life-the situations that cause you great anxiety.
Whatever your difficulty, you have two options; you can worry and assume that Jesus no longer cares, or you can resist fear putting your trust in Him. When you feel like panicking. confess your need for God andthen trust Him to care for you.
prayer: Almighty God, calm the storms that rage within us and grant us the faith to trust in Your unfailing care, even when we feel overwhelmed. Help us to resist fear and anxiety, turning instead to You for strength and peace in every circumstance. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174d182321913680
subject   : Subject: CALMING STORMS (9-28-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 27 Sep 2020 16:40:05 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse**s:*

(The disciples fear of the storm) “Teacher, don’t

you even care that we are going to drown?” When

He woke up, He rebuked the wind and said to the

water, “Quiet down.” Suddenly the wind stopped,

and there was a great calm. And He asked them,

“why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith

in Me?” (Mk. 5:38b-40)


*Today’s Reflection**:*

The disciples panicked because the storm threatened

to destroy them all, and Jesus seemed unaware and unconcerned. Theirs was a
physical storm, but storms

also come in other forms. Think about the storms in

your life—the situations that cause you great anxiety. Whatever your
difficulty,
you have two options; you

can worry and assume that Jesus no longer cares, or

you can resist fear putting your trust in Him.

*When you feel like panicking. confess your need *

*for God and**then trust Him to care for you.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE POWER TO FORGIVE
verse: (To the woman who anointed Jesus’ feet) Jesus said to the woman,“Your faith has saved you; go in peace.” (Luke 7:50)
reflection:
Overflowing love is the natural response to forgive ness and the appropriate consequence of faith. But only those who realize the depth of their sin can appre ciate the complete forgiveness God offers them. Jesus has rescued all of His followers, whether they were once extremely wicked or conventionally good from
eternal death. But the Pharisees believed that only God could forgive sins, so they wondered why this man Jesus was saying that the woman’s sins were forgiven. They did not grasp the fact that Jesus was indeed God. Do you appreciate the wideness of God’s mercy? Are you grateful for His forgiveness?
prayer: Merciful God, help us to fully grasp the depth of Your forgiveness and the vastness of Your love, that we may respond with overflowing gratitude and extend that same mercy to others. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174d6b82a1dd3adb
subject   : Subject: THE POWER TO FORGIVE (9-29-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 28 Sep 2020 16:57:08 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

(To the woman who anointed Jesus’ feet) *Jesus said*

*to the woman,**“Your faith has saved you; go in peace.” *(Lk. 7:50)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Overflowing love is the natural response to forgive-

ness and the appropriate consequence of faith. But

only those who realize the depth of their sin can appre-

ciate the complete forgiveness God offers them. Jesus

has rescued all of His followers, whether they were

once extremely wicked or conventionally good from

eternal death. But the Pharisees believed that only

God could forgive sins, so they wondered why this

man Jesus was saying that the woman’s sins were forgiven. They did not
grasp the fact that Jesus was

indeed God. *Do you appreciate the **wideness of *

*God’s mercy? Are you grateful for His **forgiveness? *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: QUESTIONING OUR FAITH
verse: One day the apostles said to the Lord, “We need more faith; tell us how to get it.” Even if you had faith as  small as a mustard seed,,”  the Lord answered, “you could say to the mulberry tree, may God uproot you  and throw you into the sea,’ and it would obey you.”  (Luke 17:5-6)
reflection:
The disciples’ request was genuine, they wanted the faith necessary for such radical forgiveness. But Jesus did not directly answer their question because the amount of faith is not as important as its genuineness. What is faith?
It is complete trust and loyalty to God that results in a willingness to do His will.
Faith is not something we use to put on a show for others. It is a complete and humble obedience to God’s will, readiness to do what ever He calls us to do. This amount of faith is not as important as the right kind of faith-Faith in our all-powerful God.
prayer: Gracious God, help us cultivate a genuine faith that leads to complete trust and humble obedience to Your will. May we focus not on the quantity of our faith, but on its quality, rooted in Your all-powerful nature and expressed through our willingness to follow Your guidance in all things. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 174dbf1535c736d4
subject   : Subject: QUESTIONING OUR FAITH (9-30-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 29 Sep 2020 17:17:40 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*One day the apostles said to the Lord, “We need more faith; tell us how to
get it.” **Even if you had faith as *

*small as a mustard seed,,” ** the Lord answered, “you*

*could say to the mulberry tree, may God uproot you *

*and throw you into the **sea,’ and it would obey you.” *

(Lk. 17:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection: *

The disciples’ request was genuine, they wanted the

faith necessary for such radical forgiveness. But Jesus

did not directly answer their question because the

amount of faith is not as important as its genuineness. *What is faith?*

*It is complete trust and loyalty to God that results in a willingness to
do His **will. ** Faith *is not* something we

use to put on a show for others. It is a complete and humble obedience to
God’s will, readiness to do what-

ever He calls us to do. This amount of faith is not as important as the
right kind of faith—*Faith in our all-powerful God.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: FAITH THAT CAUSES HEALING
verse: Peter says to the crowd, “the name of Jesus has healed this man—and you know how lame he was before. Faith in Jesus’ name has caused the healing before your very eyes.” (Acts 3:16)
reflection: Jesus not the apostles, received the glory for the healing of the lame man. In those days a man’s name represented his character. it stood for his authority and power. By using Jesus’ name, Peter showed who gave him the authority and power to heal, the apostles did not emphasize what they could do but what God could do through them. Jesus’ name is not to be used as magic-it must be used in faith. When we pray in Jesus name, we must remember that it is Christ himself not merely the sound of His name, that gives our prayers their power.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we humbly acknowledge that all power and authority belong to You alone, and we pray for the faith to use Your name with reverence and trust. Help us to remember that it is Your presence, not just the invocation of Your name, that gives our prayers their true power. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Peter says to the crowd, “the name of Jesus has healed this man—**and you
know how lame he was before. Faith in Jesus’ name has **caused the healing
before your very eyes.” *(Acts. 3:16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus not the apostles, received the glory for the healing

of the lame man. In those days a man’s name represented his charcater. it
stood for his authority and power. By using Jesus’ name, Peter showed who
gave him the auth-ority and power to heal, the apostles did not emphasize
what they could do but what God could do through them. Jesus’ name is not
to be used as magic—it must be used

in faith. When we pray in Jesus name, we must remember that it is Christ
himself *not merely the sound of His name, that gives our prayers **their
power.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: CALL TO PRAY
verse:
“Pray without ceasing.”
1 Thessalonians 5:17
reflection:
In I Thessalonians 5:17 we are told, “Pray without ceasing.” In
Colossians 4:2 it says, Continue in prayer and watch in the same
with thanks giving In Philippians 4:6 we are told to, “Be anx ious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and
supplication with thanksgiving, let your requests be known
to God.” What we see here is, the greatest of all privileges
which is not only allowed, but we are directed to do it. To
let us pray would be marvelous, but He commands us. This is
truly amazing!
prayer:
Father, thank You for the astonishing privilege and gracious
command to pray. Teach me to live in continual conversation
with You—bringing every anxiety, request, and gratitude into
Your presence. Form in me a watchful, thankful heart that
trusts Your nearness and obeys Your call to pray in all
things. Amen. (AI)

*GOD COMMANDS US TO PRAY*



In I Thess. 5:17 we are told, *“Pray without ceasing.” *In Col. 4:2 it
says, Continue in

prayer and watch in the same with thanks-

giving * In Phil. 4:6 we are told to, *“Be anx-

ious for nothing, but in everything by prayer

and supplication with thanks-giving, let your requests be known to God.” What
we see here

is, the greatest of all privileges which is not only allowed, but we are
directed to do it. To let us

pray would be marvelous, but He commands us. *This is truly amazing!*

*Pastor Sather*
